p: The oleraceins in PO have anti-inflammatory effects on lipopolysaccharide-stimulated macrophages. This component remarkably inhibited nitric oxide production and could dose-dependently decrease the secretions of interleukin 6, tumor necrosis factor α, nitric oxide, and prostaglandin E2 in cell culture supernatants, as well as the mRNA of cyclooxygenase-2 and inducible nitric oxide synthase (Li et al., 2016 ▶).
